item.title: ‘Wrong man in the dock’? – Media and War
item.author: Kelly Ameneshoa,
item.description: On Friday 16th November, Haringey Magistrates Court was the inconspicuous location for the trial of David Lawley-Wakelin. Mr Lawley-Wakelin memorably interrupted Tony Blair with cries of “This man should be arrested for war crimes” while the former Prime Minster was giving evidence at the Leveson …
